Job Title: Chief Financial Officer

Location: Greater Houston

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Job Title: Chief Financial Officer (CFO)
East 57th Street Partners is on the search for a strategic and analytical Chief Financial Officer (CFO) on behalf of one of our prestigious clients. This executive role is a full-time position ideal for a finance professional who excels in financial management, strategic planning, and organizational leadership. The CFO will play a critical role in shaping the financial strategy and direction of the company, ensuring financial health and driving growth.
Role Summary:The CFO will serve as a key member of the executive leadership team, responsible for leading the company's financial functions, including financial planning and analysis, accounting and reporting, treasury, and finance operations. The successful candidate will possess a blend of strategic vision and practical financial expertise, with a proven track record of enhancing financial performance and supporting business objectives.
Key Responsibilities:Develop and execute the financial strategy of the company, aligning financial management with the overall strategic objectives of the organization.Lead the finance team in managing all aspects of the company's finances, including budgeting, forecasting, financial reporting, and investment management.Provide strategic financial input and leadership on decision-making issues affecting the company, including evaluation of potential mergers, acquisitions, and investments.Ensure credibility of the finance group by providing timely and accurate analysis of budgets, financial trends, and forecasts.Develop and maintain systems of internal controls to safeguard financial assets of the organization and oversee federal, state, and local regulatory compliance regarding all financial functions.Work closely with other members of the executive team to advise on the financial implications of business activities and operational strategies.Manage relationships with financial institutions, investors, and external financial analysts.Oversee the capital structure of the company, determining the best mix of debt, equity, and internal financing to support the company's growth and stability.Qualifications:Proven experience as CFO, finance officer, or relevant role in a complex organization, demonstrating a successful track record in financial leadership.Strong understanding of corporate financial law and risk management practices.Excellent knowledge of data analysis and forecasting methods.Proficient in the use of financial management software (e.g., ERP systems).An analytical mind with a strategic ability to think broadly about the business and its financial needs.Excellent organizational and leadership skills.Outstanding communication and interpersonal abilities.BSc/BA in Accounting, Finance, or relevant field; MSc/MBA or relevant certification (e.g., CPA or CFA) is preferred.Benefits:Competitive executive compensation package, including performance bonuses and equity options.Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance plans.Retirement savings plan with company contribution.Generous vacation and personal leave policies.Opportunities for professional development and career progression in a dynamic and supportive work environment.
East 57th Street Partners is dedicated to finding a CFO who will significantly contribute to our client's financial success and strategic growth. This role is perfect for a financial leader passionate about driving change, fostering innovation, and enhancing financial performance at every level of the organization.

Experience Level (if available): Executive
